instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power green Lighth
threads.message:
Hi. all lines with red highlighter are missing.

Any contribution will be welcome. 

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power green Lighth
threads.message:
You have a nice power on sequence in page 3; did you check any signal?
I saw you checked S0 voltages, when S3 are not present, why?

Keep in mind, this board is more than 10 yo, MCP could be dead now.
